posts.name:
Chuck Herrin, CISSP, CCSP, NACD.DC
Chuck Herrin, CISSP, CCSP, NACD.DC
posts.content:
Wouldn‚Äôt it be cool if we had AI models that were trained on the knowledge available each year we were growing up? 

I‚Äôd love to go back and ask 1995GPT what it thought about some issue today.

Each of these model cutoff dates is essentially a frozen record of knowledge as of that date - it‚Äôs going to be fascinating to look back in just a few years and see how much we‚Äôve learned.
posts.commentAdded: What a thought-provoking idea! It would be fascinating to see how past knowledge shapes our current perspectives and innovations.

posts.name:
Mary Casey
Mary Casey
posts.content:
There‚Äôs something truly powerful about stepping outside the mold, even when the world tells you that you don‚Äôt quite ‚Äúfit.‚Äù

Ageism, bias, and rigid industry standards can make you feel like your opportunities are slipping away with time. I‚Äôve seen it in tech, where turning 40 can feel like a career ceiling. But here‚Äôs the truth: when you step into your own power, build your own voice, and create on your own terms, no one can tell you ‚Äúno.‚Äù

No one can say you‚Äôre too old, not experienced enough, or that you don‚Äôt belong‚Äîwhen you‚Äôve built something uniquely yours, when the door they‚Äôre knocking on is the one you‚Äôve crafted.

As women, our career paths are often defined by navigating hurdles‚Äîbeing underestimated, overlooked, or held to impossible standards. But the turning point comes when we stop chasing external validation and instead focus inward, on developing our own perspective, our own voice, and our own point of view as leaders. That‚Äôs when things start to shift.

I‚Äôve come to realize that I don‚Äôt need to meet every company, industry, or executive where they are. Instead, I need to fully own where I am‚Äîmy skills, my creativity, and the voice I‚Äôve built through my experiences. The more I do this, the more I find or create opportunities that align with me, rather than trying to mold myself to fit their expectations.

It‚Äôs not easy. It‚Äôs slower. It‚Äôs harder. But it‚Äôs also so much freer, so much more rewarding, and so much more powerful to lead with authenticity and confidence.

When you focus on growing what inspires you, what drives you, and what makes you unique, opportunities will follow‚Äîwhether you find them or create them yourself.

Wherever you are in your journey, remember this: no one can tell you ‚Äúyou can‚Äôt‚Äù when what you‚Äôre offering is a magic that only you can create.

comments.commentText:
No one ever tells me no, they just go silent.
I don‚Äôt ask anymore, I offer.

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely inspiring! Embracing our unique journey not only empowers us but also paves the way for authentic opportunities. Keep shining! üåü

posts.content:
For the past 18 months, I've been living the dream! Family trips, bucket-list adventures, and even racing the Baja 1000 - check, check, check!  But throughout it all, I couldn't ignore the incredible strides being made in AI, particularly with AI Agents. These powerful tools have the potential to truly transform how we work and live.

Sometimes you have to step away to see things more clearly. This time gave me a fresh perspective on what truly matters. And while I cherished every moment with family and friends, the pull of technology, especially the transformative power of AI, pulled me back in!

I'm incredibly excited to embark on a new journey as Field CTO & SVP of Field Engineering at!is already doing amazing things with Agentic AI, and I can't wait to help them scale their impact to hundreds of Fortune 1000 companies and thousands of users. I'm eager to leverage my experience and passion to helpdemocratize AI and empower businesses to build a brighter future.

Let's build a better future together!  Connect with me if you're interested in learning more about how AI Agents can revolutionize your business!

posts.name:
Neha K Puri
Neha K Puri
posts.content:
Stop telling entrepreneurs to 'work smart.' That advice cost me 2 years of growth. Here's what nobody tells you...

You can't know what "smart" looks like until you've done it the hard way first.

When I took the leap into entrepreneurship years ago, I made every "dumb" mistakes:

‚Ä¢ Hired without proper research

‚Ä¢ Didn't set clear boundaries between family and business (big mistake!)

‚Ä¢ Confused long hours with real productivity and add the below pointers as well.

‚Ä¢Said yes to every client (even the red flags)

‚Ä¢Tried to do everything myself

But here's the plot twist:

Each of these "mistakes" taught me something priceless about working smart.

Now I know:

- Smart is giving freshers a chance and watching them become company pillars

- Smart is focusing on results, not hours logged

But I couldn't have learned any of this without doing it the hard way.

The truth is:

Working smart isn't a shortcut.

It's the reward for working hard enough to learn what doesn't work.

So to all the entrepreneurs just starting:

Don't feel bad about making mistakes.

Don't beat yourself up for taking the long route.

Don't compare your behind-the-scenes with someone else's highlights.

You're not doing it wrong.

You're just learning how to do it right.

That's exactly how you discover your own version of "working smart."

What's the hardest lesson that taught you to work smarter?

comments.commentText:
This hits home! 'Working smart' really is the prize you earn after slogging through the tough lessons. I‚Äôve been there too‚Äîsaying yes to red-flag clients, trying to juggle everything solo, and mistaking busyness for productivity. 

But those so-called 'mistakes' were the ultimate teachers. They taught me that boundaries are a superpower, and the right team can transform everything.

The hardest lesson? Learning to say 'no'‚Äîto clients, to distractions, to my own ego. Funny how saying 'no' opened the door to more meaningful 'yeses.'

Neha K Puri What about you? What's your biggest 'hard lesson turned smart win' moment?"

Sachin Verma Love how you‚Äôve turned challenges into valuable lessons! 

Boundaries and focus really are game-changers in the journey to meaningful success.

Saying this with complete authencity Neha K Puri I relate to every single word..living it all..learning the hard way to reach the smart, have no qualms in accepting it..seems like you read my mind. Thank you !! Ô∏è
Mital Khobarekar The hard lessons truly pave the way for meaningful growth, glad this resonated with you!
True that  Thanks Neha K Puri :)

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Each mistake shapes our path to success. Embracing the journey is key to discovering what truly works! üöÄ

posts.content:
Discipline is the unspoken hero of success.

It‚Äôs not glamorous. It‚Äôs hard work:

 Late nights.
 Early mornings.
 Empty pockets.
 No crowd cheering you on.
But what separates those who achieve their goals from those who don‚Äôt is their unwavering commitment to the process. It‚Äôs just you, your belief in God, and your determination.

Stay the course. The results will speak for themselves.
